snippet: A maritime law from 1920 is delaying the shipment of the road salt, because there is no ship with a United States flag and crew available at the moment to deliver it.
abstract: New Jersey officials are confounded by maritime law from 1920, which is delaying shipment of road salt, because there is no ship with a United States flag and crew available to deliver it; New Jersey Transportation Department bought the salt earlier this month to replenish its stock but with warmer temperatures, need for it may have abated by time it arrives.

byline.original: By COREY KILGANNON and MARC SANTORA

lead_paragraph: A maritime law from 1920 is delaying the shipment of the road salt, because there is no ship with a United States flag and crew available at the moment to deliver it.

headline.main: 40,000 Tons of New Jersey Salt, Stuck in Maine
headline.print_headline: 40,000 Tons of New Jersey Salt, Stuck in Maine
